revisions.*: Because "rvslots" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used.

(1838) | synonyms_ref = | synonyms = ''Agaricus helvolus'' [[Pers.]] (1796)
''Agaricus gentilis'' Fr. (1821)
''Telamonia gentilis'' (Fr.) [[Friedrich Otto Wünsche|Wünsche]] (1877)
''Lepiota helvola'' (Pers.) [[Samuel Frederick Gray|Gray]] (1821)
''Hydrocybe helvola'' ([[Jean Baptiste François Pierre Bulliard|Bull.]]) [[M.M.Moser]] (1953) }} {{mycomorphbox | name = Cortinarius gentilis | whichGills =adnexed | capShape =convex | hymeniumType=gills | stipeCharacter=cortina | ecologicalType=mycorrhizal | sporePrintColor=reddish-brown | howEdible=deadly }} '''''Cortinarius gentilis''''' is a deadly [[fungus]] of the genus ''[[Cortinarius]]'', normally found in [[North America]] and [[Europe]].{{cite web |title=''Cortinarius gentilis'' |author=Phillips R |work=Rogers Mushrooms |url=http://www.rogersmushrooms.com/gallery/DisplayBlock~bid~5394~gid~~source~gallerydefault.asp |access-date=2011-03-16 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110715195854/http://www.rogersmushrooms.com/gallery/DisplayBlock~bid~5394~gid~~source~gallerydefault.asp |archive-date=2011-07-15 |url-status=dead }} ==Toxicity== In a study in Finland, dried and homogenized ''C. gentilis'' and ''[[Cortinarius orellanus|C. orenallus]]'' mushrooms were orally introduced into a rat. Both species caused renal damage only, the changes of which corresponded to [[tubulo-interstitial nephritis]].{{cite journal|last=Möttönen|first=M|author2=Nieminen, L |author3=Heikkilä, H |title=Damage caused by two finnish mushrooms, Cortinarius speciosissimus and Cortinarius gentilis on the rat kidney.|journal=Zeitschrift für Naturforschung C|date=Sep–Oct 1975|volume=30|issue=5|pages=668–71|pmid=129997}} ''C. gentilis'' has been found to be [[nephrotoxic]] to rats.{{cite journal|last=Schumacher|first=Trond|author2=Klaus Høiland |title=Mushroom poisoning caused by species of the genus ''Cortinarius'' Fries|journal=Archives of Toxicology|date=June 1983|volume=53|issue=2|pages=87–106|doi=10.1007/BF00302720|issn=1432-0738}} ==See also== {{Portal|Fungi}} *[[List of deadly fungi]] ==References== {{Reflist|refs= {{cite web |url=http://www.mycobank.org/MycoTaxo.aspx?Link=T&Rec=222010 |title=''Cortinarius gentilis'' (Fr.) Fr. 1838 |publisher=International Mycological Association |work=MycoBank |accessdate=2011-03-19}} }} {{Wikispecies}} {{Taxonbar|from=Q2614222}} [[Category:Cortinarius|gentilis]] [[Category:Fungi of North America]] [[Category:Fungi of Europe]] [[Category:Fungi described in 1796]] {{Cortinariaceae-stub}}
